content:
Lets look at what happens in troubleshooting mode. Your graphics are set to a default value which is in essence the setting "hardware acceleration" disabled. Addons are disabled. The user interface is largely returned to its default

Those later two can be made more permanent by using the reset button that comes up when you start in Troubleshooting mode. I really don't think those are your issue, but please try them anyway, including going into settings and disabling hardware acceleration.

Finally antivirus/security suites have these "things" they claim to offer like anti scam and anti spam tools which they inject into the Thunderbird running process instead of using the normal addon route. Just like the malware they claim to be defeating really. When this goes wrong, there is no way to block these insidious worms within Thunderbird, like disable an addon. But safe mode blocks all addons and it is the addon interface that the antivirus vendors exploit for their malware er tools. So go to your antivirus product and disable an toolbar or scan or spam tools (it used to be trend in particular but these days most of the products are owned by about two or three companies so the name on the package is somewhat irrelevant.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
This is interesting. If I have any other application in focus Snagit works perfectly using the [PrintScreen] hotkey. However, as soon as I give Thunderbird focus the hotkey ceases to work. It makes me think Thunderbird is using [PrintScreen] for something else, but I can't find any reference to it on the Internet.

You are correct about some Windows thing (I've never used) when I press [Ctrl]+[Shift]+[PrintScreen], which shows a cross-hair. But Snagit no longer works when TB has focus (fine when something else has focus). I've sent a support request into them but I'm not sure how that's going to go when it works with any other application open (having focus).
creator: BPaul_H

content: There is a setting in W11 to make the PrintScreen key bound to Snip (Winkey+Shift+S). If the setting is Off, PrintScreen acts like before, capturing the active window to the clipboard. But I don't know why TB would affect Snagit differently from other apps.

content: Issues like this are normally where the individual has multiple accounts with the same email provider, with only small differences between them. Is the name that appears used in one of the other accounts?
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks, David ... but, no - it's not a similar name. But I kept searching and realised that the old Your Name had been put into the address folders with that email address. I just deleted that, checked that I had the correct name in the address folder with that address, and all is fixed. Seems that the system was using that name from the address folder rather than the name I had put into the account details. Anyway, I'll close the question now. Colin
creator: colinfryer

content: A possibility might be to go online at gmail.com and set the allmail folder to not be available via IMAP.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David,

I thought of that, and I didn't want to do it just yet because it would remove the All Mail folder from my phone as well (although this could be a benefit as well).

Anyhow, just to verify, I just looked at the setting of the "faulty" account on gmail.com and noticed something very interesting: 1. Under "Forwarding and POP/IMAP", "Disable IMAP" is selected ("Enable IMAP" is selected in another account that is working well). 2. Under "Labels", there's no option to choose whether folders are available via IMAP. The option does appear on my other account that has IMAP enabled.

So, I'll enable IMAP on the Google side of my "faulty" account, and take it from there. I'm surprised Thunderbird and my iPhone have been able to link this account in IMAP mode if Gmail is set to Disable IMAP (and without so much as an error message).

Thanks,

- Martin
creator: gamin1

content: My guess is you are using a language other than English and the page being supplied by your mail provider is not necessarily showing all of the page. perhaps if is off the bottom of the screen and you need to scroll, perhaps it has other issues because the language you use requires more space than the provider allowed. Some 30 years ago in the early days of windows I was told at a developer forum that French for instance requires about 30% more space to hold translated information that the English original. Not that I speak from experience as I have no French skills at all.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
A forum post from 2020 suggests these settings:

incoming POP server mail.hughes.net on port 995, SSL/TLS, normal password, user name = email address

outgoing SMTP server smtp.hughes.net on port 465, SSL/TLS, normal password, user name = email address
creator: sfhowes

content: Post your server settings, and whether you applied OAuth2 authentication with an account password, or 'normal password' authentication with an app password. The AOL servers imap.aol.com, smtp.aol.com or pop.aol.com use OAuth2, while a Verizon server like smtp.verizon.net requires an app password.
creator: sfhowes

content: I had tried the verizon.net server with normal password (which worked on my old computer and is the same as on my husbands computer) with no luck. I had also tried the aol.com pop server but was using normal password there as well. When I changed it to OAuth2 it had me sign into my aol account and my emails came over. However immediately after that an exception box popped up and I can't continue until I do something about it. I'm not even sure what it's asking me to do. I added a screenshot. Is this because aol handles verizon email? How should I proceed? Thanks.
creator: christinejohnson2

content: Those certificate alerts usually appear when your antivirus is scanning secure connections. Recommend you disable email scanning (e.g. Avast/AVG Mail Shield) or add TB profile folder as exception or exclusion to antivirus scanning. This is not a security risk as the real-time background scan is unaffected.
creator: sfhowes

content: You have been very helpful, thank you. One more. So now that I got rid of the exception I can read my verizon/aol email. Now the problem is I can't send them. Even though at set up I chose aol.com servers for incoming and outgoing it defaulted outgoing to verizon. (pic 1). I changed outgoing to aol (pic 2). I can't send email with either configuration.
creator: christinejohnson2

content:
The settings in both pictures are correct, except use the full email address for the User Name. See if you can then send on smtp.aol.com - it should use the same oauth:// token that's used for the incoming. If not, try the smtp.verizon.net server, but use an app password in TB in place of the account password:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1364324

It is likely that Thunderbird has informed you that the oath security has been changed to oath02 or a newer version of it, and Thunderbird will release the necessary number of software updates to obtain it. It is best to be up to date with these released updates as much as possible. And it is recommended to adjust this surrounding backend configuration accordingly, especially your server configuration.

content:
Incoming messages can be tagged automatically when getting new mail, by creating filters that apply a tag, based on various criteria, e.g. From, Subject etc. In Table View, the colour of the text in the message list takes the colour of the tag. There is an add-on that applies the colour to the background of the cells in the list.

In Cards View, a coloured icon is displayed, but it's possible to make the card text match the tag colour:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1455376

Also possible to make the card background colour match the tag colour, with css: 

/* make card bg color same as tag color */ tr[is="thread-card"] .card-container {      background-color: var(--tag-color) !important;  }
creator: sfhowes

content:
Hello there We have read the message We try to help

If you would like to choose to be able to add a tag to your posts, click on the desired message and choose tag here and select the subject new tag. The internal tag will be added in Thunderbird later, if you want to add more tags or a name change, you can do this if you want to do so, but the internal tag will remain stored primarily on the imap server. For all these actions you can choose a name for the tag, which are in different colors but cannot be chosen from colored palettes, balls or stars. Then you should turn to the rounding up and/or extensions of The Thunderbird collection.

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird
